revised_title: Determining Industrial Stack Heights for Air Pollution Control
tldr: This article discusses a method to provide meteorological information to air pollution authorities to help them decide on minimum industrial stack heights. The method uses micrometeorological methods and considers factors like wind velocity, cloudiness, and source height to determine the diffusion of noxious gases. The authors propose a scheme that can be programmed for a computer to calculate maximum surface concentrations and their distances from the source, allowing authorities to make informed decisions on air pollution measures.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Air Pollution and Meteorology
